intro: Trichilia watorikensis, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and satinwood species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and alternate, simple leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
